newsitem.title: USA: Clarify sees little Q2 rev growth vs Q1.
newsitem.headline: Clarify sees little Q2 rev growth vs Q1.

text.p: Clarify Inc Tuesday said it expects little, if any revenue growth in the second quarter of 1997 from the first quarter.
Earlier, the company reported a first quarter profit of $1.95 million or $0.09 a share, up from $868,000 or $0.04 in the same period in 1996.
Revenues for the first quarter of 1997 were $19.36 million, up from $8.95 million in the first quarter of 1996 and $19.2 million in the fourth quarter of last year.
"Expanding our sales force is a challenge," said Ray Fritz, chief financial officer at Clarify. "We expect little, if any, revenue growth rate for the second quarter over the first quarter in 1997."
The company did not provide additional details for the revenue forecast.

After the company released its results, shares of the computer software provider fell to 7-1/8 in after hours trading from a close of 16-3/4 on the Nasdaq. The stock lost 2-5/8 in regular hours trading.
